oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Felix Kirk Zollicoffer
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Born in Maury County, Tennessee, Felix Zollicoffer was a newspaper editor and owner for several newspapers in the South. Prior to the Civil War, Zollicoffer served Tennessee as State Printer, Comptroller of the Treasury, Adjutant General, and state senator. He was then elected to the U.S. Congress for the state of Tennessee, serving from 1853-1859. He attended the unsuccessful Peace Conference in Washington in hopes of preventing a war. During the Civil War, he served as Brigadier General in the Confederate Army, dying in battle as a result of wounds at the Battle of Mill Springs in 1862.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Brady's National Photographic Portrait Galleries
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Men; Military officers; Legislators; Newspaper editors; Uniforms
